BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution. In addition the danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack is frozen, but not to a significant depth. The fresh snow and in particular the wind slabs can still be released in some cases in particular on very steep north, east and southwest facing slopes and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. These are to be found especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
In particular in the regions with a lot of snow more mostly small moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of solar radiation. The wind slabs of the weekend will be covered with new snow and therefore barely recognisable.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Afternoon: Little snow will fall in some regions.
In some places wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies in particular at intermediate and high altitudes and along the border with Switzerland. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
Sunny slopes: As a consequence of falling temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack will consolidate during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The meteorological conditions will facilitate a slow strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As the day progresses wet snow slides and avalanches are to be expected. Wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small moist snow slides and avalanches are to be expected. This applies in particular on sunny slopes. The avalanche danger will increase during the day.
Wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area.
Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering in particular on steep shady slopes, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
At low and intermediate altitudes a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses more mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of moist avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: On Friday it will be very warm over a wide area. The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase during the day. Below approximately 2600 m small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow. The wind slabs have formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in the high Alpine regions. The fresh wind slabs can be released by small loads. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released by winter sport participants in particular on very steep northwest, north and northeast facing slopes. Weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2100 m. The snowpack is largely stable; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow. The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes. Weak layers exist in the snowpack in particular on northwest, north and northeast facing slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs require caution. As the day progresses wet loose snow slides are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The more recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In isolated cases avalanches are medium-sized.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation wet loose snow slides are to be expected below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on extremely steep sunny slopes.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The wind slabs are lying on soft layers on shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes. These conditions will cause a weakening of the near-surface layers as the day progresses.

Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals but is hard to trigger.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses wet loose snow slides are possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs require caution. As the day progresses wet loose snow slides are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The more recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In isolated cases avalanches are medium-sized.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation wet loose snow slides are to be expected below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on extremely steep sunny slopes.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The wind slabs are lying on soft layers on shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes. These conditions will cause a weakening of the near-surface layers as the day progresses.

Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals but is hard to trigger.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses wet loose snow slides are possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: In the regions with a lot of snow the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. As the day progresses in particular on steep sunny slopes there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Some medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible. This applies in particular in case of a large load.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
Weak layers exist in the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet avalanches as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase a little on very steep sunny slopes at elevated altitudes. The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend can be released, especially by large additional loads, especially on very steep sunny slopes at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. This applies especially on shady slopes as well as, along the border with France.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in some places on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of falling temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack will consolidate.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will appreciably increase. Old wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. This applies on sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m, as well as on rocky slopes at elevated altitudes. Mostly avalanches are only small but in many cases easily released.
The old wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2400 m, and in gullies and bowls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m.
The old wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes and at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses wet loose snow slides are possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will appreciably increase. Old wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. This applies on sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m, as well as on rocky slopes at elevated altitudes. Mostly avalanches are only small but in many cases easily released.
The old wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2400 m, and in gullies and bowls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m.
The old wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes and at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses wet loose snow slides are possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming more moist and wet avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
A mostly overcast night: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already increase in the early morning.
In particular intermediate altitudes: As a consequence of warming during the day there will be an additional increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2800 m, in particular at the base of rock walls.

The visible wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases, especially at their margins. These avalanche prone locations are rather rare and are easy to recognise. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on steep sunny slopes. The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend have bonded quite well with the old snowpack in particular on sunny slopes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will rapidly decrease. The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Slight increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more mostly small wet loose snow slides are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on extremely steep sunny slopes.

The more recent wind slabs are now only very rarely prone to triggering. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on extremely steep shady slopes in high Alpine regions. Avalanches are small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes. These conditions will cause a weakening of the near-surface layers as the day progresses.

The weather conditions fostered a stabilisation of the snow drift accumulations.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the temperature drops there will be a decrease in the danger of wet snow slides.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Slight increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more mostly small wet loose snow slides are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on extremely steep sunny slopes.

The more recent wind slabs are now only very rarely prone to triggering. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on extremely steep shady slopes in high Alpine regions. Avalanches are small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes. These conditions will cause a weakening of the near-surface layers as the day progresses.

The weather conditions fostered a stabilisation of the snow drift accumulations.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the temperature drops there will be a decrease in the danger of wet snow slides.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Only isolated mostly small avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The avalanche prone locations are rather rare and are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. From the late morning as a consequence of solar radiation there will be only a slight increase in the danger of dry and moist avalanches, especially on very steep sunny slopes above approximately 2300 m, as well as on wind-loaded slopes especially at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack will be generally well bonded. A clear night will be followed in the early morning by quite favourable conditions mostly. Especially sunny slopes: The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be generally well bonded.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes. Small avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: A little snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As the day progresses more small loose snow slides are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small moist loose snow slides are to be expected. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes. The avalanche danger will increase a little during the day.

Wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area.

Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering in particular on steep shady slopes, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses only isolated wet snow slides and avalanches are possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow at high altitude.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of new snow and wind individual mostly small avalanches are possible above approximately 1700 m. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as on very steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. At intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying. At high altitude mostly small wind slabs formed. In gullies and bowls the wind slabs are larger. The small quantity of fresh snow of the last few days and the mostly small wind slabs are lying on top of a favourable old snowpack above approximately 1700 m.
